page.description: Basically a Namespace allows Alpha Anywhere to organize classes into logical "folders". You can think of the :: directive as much like a slash when you define a path. The Xbasicmodule class in Alpha Anywhere is stored in the type namespace. See also Xbasic Objects, Namespaces.

argument.name: Namespace
argument.description: A category or collection of functions.

section.title: Examples:
section.description: The connection object is in the sql namespace.
The adodb.connection object is in the ole namespace.
